root.text:
Hello, we've got our devnet instance and are ready to join the network. 

Please whitelist our devnet, testnet and mainet node IPs for onboarding.

devnet ip: 34.128.157.65. 
testnet ip: 34.111.87.78
mainnet ip: 34.49.173.90

Can you please whitelist them?
<@U05GMHJ2TRA> <@U02JH3RBABB>

Sponsor is Digital Assets

text: Could you just run a `curl <http://ifconfig.me|ifconfig.me>` from a pod on your cluster to double check your egress IP please?

elements.text: from a pod on your cluster to double check your egress IP please?

text:
eg something like
```kubectl run nginx --image nginx
kubectl exec -it nginx -- bash
curl <http://ifconfig.me|ifconfig.me>
curl <https://scan.sv-1.test.global.canton.network.digitalasset.com>
exit
kubectl delete pod nginx```

text: Thanks <@U02JH3RBABB> - will check that now.

Hi <@U0422PVKRFZ>.

In a hypothetical scenario of a self-run validator node, if the secret key is lost, would it be possible to regenerate the secret key or would the solution be to rotate the canton node keys as stated above?

Would like to know what would be the recommended course of action to take please.

text:
Hi all - can someone tell me what this command is doing and if we should be concerned that a M2M key with just daml_ledger_api scope (no participantAdmin) can execute it?

```participant.keys.secret.download_to(participant.keys.secret.list(filterName = "signing").head.publicKey.fingerprint, "key.file")```

elements.text: Hi all - can someone tell me what this command is doing and if we should be concerned that a M2M key with just daml_ledger_api scope (no participantAdmin) can execute it?

text: That's currently expected, auth is not yet enabled for the Canton admin API. That's why it's not exposed through the ingress by default.
